byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and David E. Sanger from Washington.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei objects to key principles in nation's nuclear deal, asserting that economic sanctions must be lifted as soon as final agreement is signed and rejecting inspections of Iran's military bases; Sec of State John Kerry and other negotiators say sanctions are to be phased out in stages, as Iran complies with its obligations.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, declared on Thursday that all sanctions would have to be lifted on the day any deal is signed and that military sites would be strictly off limits to foreign inspectors.

headline.main: Iran’s Supreme Leader Says Sanctions Must Lift When Nuclear Deal Is Signed
headline.print_headline: Leader of Iran Challenges U.S. On Pact Details

snippet: Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, declared on Thursday that all sanctions would have to be lifted on the day any deal is signed and that military sites would be strictly off limits to foreign inspectors.
